Reviews.Title: A Wonderful Little Camera...that LOVES Batteries
Reviews.Author: Been There "World Traveler"
Reviews.Content: If you can get past the battery usage factor, you will love this camera!  I bought it after reading good reviews elsewhere (it had just been released and there were no amazon.com reviews at that time).  I wanted something reasonable (but better than a kiddie camera) for my soon-to-be 6 year old niece.  She took the camera everywhere during a trip to Washington, DC and was able to operate it with ease (although she never quite got the concept of the zoom...but that didn't matter to her).What is good about this camera is you can set the program to eliminate "shake" or motion from the picture.  If you accidentally moved the camera while taking a photo, it corrects the picture before saving it.  This is simply amazing.  Using this function resulted in superb pictures every time.  When I decided that this function was consuming too much of the battery life, I turned it off, but after a couple of photos it was clear that it improves the photo even when you think you have a pretty steady hand...so I turned it back on.The box included a set of AA batteries but no rechargeable batteries or battery charger.  Those are optional items, as is a cover.  I bought a 4 GB media card for $11 and that is the way to go with this camera.  You'll run out of battery life long before you run out of photo capacity!  After doing some research, I opted for the alkaline batteries recommended by the owner's manual.  I believe that results in superior photos over the rechargeable batteries and was extremely happy with the performance.  For the $93 that I paid, this easily performs on par with my other $300 small digital, although it does consume the batteries like there is no tomorrow!  So make sure you take plenty with you (buy them on sale!) and you'll have a great time with this camera.I really wanted to give this product 5 stars for value & performance, but opted for 4 stars solely because of the battery usage factor.

Reviews.Title: Takes good Quality Pictures, terrible parts.
Reviews.Author: A. Gilchrist
Reviews.Content: I brought this camera a few months ago since my other one was a bit outdated. The price was right and It was modern looking so it seemed like the right choice for me.ProsHas good modes (esp beauty mode)Takes sharp crisp picturesHas a Large bright LCD screenHas a Guidance menu that tells you what all the functions do.ConsNo look thru View finder.Eats Batteries regardless of being lithium batteries ( like they recommend)Tough to access different camera modes many menus have to be accessed.No Mode Wheel ( easy for turning to modes)The lens the motor is weak it frequently gets stuck and mine ultimately broke.The reason why I did give this product some stars , is because it takes beautiful pictures. I am sad that the mechanical aspects have to bog this camera down.I ended up taking mine apart because the motor on the lens did not work anymore.Not saying this happens for many people.. I have many samsung items and I am happy with them all except this one.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Anne Phillips "Annie"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome value for the money. It's a bit bigger than some others on the market, but that's because it uses regular AA batteries (2) rather than having to charge via AC or USB plug like some other cameras. I like that feature b/c I can use rechargeable AA batteries and not worry about being able to charge the camera itself all the time....Also b/c it is a bit bigger, it's easier to use/handle. At least that's what my friends with really tiny cameras think!The flash was my concern and how will indoor pictures look like, but they look great. Zoom is pretty good as well and the camera comes with USB cord, so download is easy as well....overall, an excellent camera I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Takes nice pics and movies; a certified battery punisher
Reviews.Author: Iconophoric
Reviews.Content: The manual that comes with the sl30 recommends Alkaline batteries or rechargeable Ni-MH batteries. I have found that, no matter which type you use, this camera goes through batteries much more quickly than my previous point and shoot, the Canon Powershot A95. I believe the problem is in the design. The Powershot used 4 AA cells and had a smaller display, and the Samsung sl30, with a larger display, uses only two AA cells. This design choice kept the camera compact and light. But I think Samsung was somewhat disingenuous in making the calculated decision to get the consumer in the door with the sexiness of this little camera, and then leave them holding the bag when it comes to the most routine aspect of ownership/upkeep.Whereas I was able to take the Canon along for a nine hour day at Disneyland this summer and never give a second thought about battery life, the Samsung sl30 has depleted one of it's three bars indicating battery power left just in casual (not constant) shooting around the house and yard for less than an hour total. 30 more shots and a couple of short movies later, and time to reload. (A friend says that sudden battery depletion is a characteristic of rechargeables: two or three bars indicating battery health one minute, then kaput the next. I can't swear that this is always or even often true, but since I have had this camera, I have seen things which make me believe it. I have seen it go from three bars -- full battery indicator -- to the dread battery replacement message in the space of less than five minutes, on the next power-up.)So the consumer has two choices with this camera, as I see it, if they buy it and decide to keep it. You can make a major investment in Alkaline batteries at Megamart, always carrying a couple of sixteen packs of them with you on vacation, and just try to forget that this thing uses batteries like a toy cassette recorder from 1970. Or you can buy a brace of rechargeables and always have a couple of rechargers plugged in back at the hotel with all slots filled.Important note: The Duracell Ni-MH battery recharger I bought just for the batteries specified for this camera (which are rated at 1700 mAh, by the way) lists a recovery time of a whopping five hours. Yes, I said "five hours". With the Samsung sl30, spontanaeity -- that selling point so beloved by advertisers, that quality so coveted by consumers of cameras of this class -- certainly takes a back seat to old school camera nerd/hobbyist planning ahead and lugging extra supplies around.To explain my rating, I give the camera almost 5 stars for the quality of pics it takes, and ease of use. (The flash on the sl30 is more forgiving than the super-hot flash on the Canon Powershot A95; this was my one complaint with the Canon the whole time I had it.) I allow it a somewhat generous 3 stars because of the battery problem. Net out around 4.Not a terrible camera. But I think it's important that you know what you're getting into when you buy this camera. If getting on the battery-buying or battery-stress track is a deal breaker for you, you might want to look at a different camera.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: monkeybutt
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my kids (ages 6 and 8).  We used it at Yellowstone.  The color was good (better at times than my Canon Elph).  There are lots of functions-more than I would  ever use, but the kids enjoyed them!  Battery life was good (we used camera batteries).  Bottom line, this is a fun, easy to use camera that takes really good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Retired in Florida
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our trip to Bermuda so I would not have to carry my bigger SLR camera. After reading previous reviews, I was somewhat concerned about battery life even though I prefer the easy to replace AA batteries in this model. After using the camera inside and outside to become familiar with its functions, I found it to be simple to understand and easy to change settings. The pictures were bright and clear. The batteries lasted through my trial run easily. I replaced the batteries with fresh top of the line Mallory batteries before our trip and we were off on vacation. Over a period of several days, I snapped over 200 pictures inside with flash as well as outside under a variety of conditions, on the bright and sunny beaches in the "beach" mode; beautiful sunsets in the "sunset" mode; close up shots of the many flowers and even inside in the "back light" mode. Under most outside conditions, I had no problem composing a picture on the camera screen. In the bright sun, however, it is a little difficult to make out the screen. It was not usually a problem. I was careful not to keep reviewing my pictures as I do believe that this causes the biggest drain on battery life. I returned home and easily loaded the pictures into my computer Photoshop program. I am very pleased with the quality and exposure of the pictures and am still using the same batteries. I did not use the CD that came with the camera but simply plugged in the enclosed USB cord to download directly to my Photoshop. My computer has Vista and there is no problem with compatibility. The convenience of having a pocket size camera that is ready to use at any moment is something I am very pleased about. I do believe that taking a little time to get used to the camera will provide anyone with a lot of joy.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: PapaSmerf
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my four year old as a Christmas present. I wanted something that worked well, with a great price.  If it happened to break I wasn't out all that much cash.  I tell you, this camera takes better pictures than my $300 Canon and all other digital cameras I've had.  It takes pictures quickly and reloads the next shot. Colors are warm and images are beautifully focused, even in the hands of a four year old. Regular AA batteries have held up really well until we purchase some rechargeables. Highly recommended. I might even buy another one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price, a little touchy with dark and bright spots
Reviews.Author: A Customer "customer12345657"
Reviews.Content: First, I don't want anyone to be disappointed.  This is not a substitute for a Canon costing twice as much.  It's noisier in dark areas, and more likely to get washed-out areas when extremely bright spots in in the frame.  If you want to minimize imperfections, you will have to pay more.However, all cameras have those issues to some degree, and the good news is that this camera is better than any other I have seen in this price range.  If you want a camera for eighty bucks, this is the first autofocus/zoom camera for that price I have seen which works well.Here's the good news:1. It focuses and takes the picture quickly.  Focusing and capturing the image takes about half a second in most cases.  If you pre-focus by pressing the button halfway, the final click is nearly instant.  Slow focusing is one of the most annoying things you can experience when using a camera for the first time, and it is no problem at all with this one.  Some of Nikon's [more expensive] compact models take twice as long, but this Samsung is on par with most other decent cameras.2. The zoom works fast enough as well.  Not as fast as some really expensive cameras, but some cameras this cheap have a horribly slow zoom.  No real problem here.3. The flash operates fairly fast.  Like a lot of cheap cameras, this one always does a double-flash.  But it does so fast enough that your subjects won't be confused by it, which is a problem with many cheap cameras.  The first flash comes, and everyone's faces drop because they think it is over.  This camera does the double-flash so fast you will hardly notice.4. It powers on and off pretty fast, only requiring about 1 second for either operation.  Nothing sucks more than wanting to take a picture, but missing it because your slow camera thinks you want to stare at the manufacturer's logo for 5 seconds.  Note that powering down can be delayed if the camera is still displaying the brief preview of the image you just took, and the first shot may take up to 4 seconds upon power-up if you are indoors and have the flash turned on.  This is another area where many cheap cameras are bad, but this one is great.5. It has some advanced settings for such a low-priced basic camera.  There is a "program" mode, which allows some very basic settings (not aperture or shutter speed though).  One handy setting (applying to all modes) is the choice of how long the picture "Quick View", which is when the camera briefly displays the image captured after you take it, is displayed (some cameras call it a "preview" even though it is really a post-view).  Options are 3 seconds, 1 second, 0.5 second, or off.  This may seem like a minor setting, but it can be a very annoying difference if you are switching from an old camera to a new one and this feature is different.6. In the final pictures, color is fairly accurate.  Not perfect, but nothing weird.  This is normally only a problem with really cheap models, but this cheap camera seems fine.Some issues:1. The display is not so good.  It's a little darker than the Samsung L100, and it has a grainy and noisy appearance.2. The program mode must be selected by entering the menu.  It would be much handier to have a standard external dial or switch, as many other cameras do.3. When the flash is recharging, you can't change settings... including turning the flash off.  A lot of cheap cameras do this, and I have no idea why, but it's annoying.Important:Don't use alkaline batteries, it will just make you angry.  Cameras use a lot of power, if only in short bursts, and alkaline batteries overheat and waste energy when drained quickly.  It is convenient that, if this camera's batteries die, you can just grab some standard AA alkalines anywhere in a pinch.  But they die really fast.  The included alkalines died before I filled a 256 MB card (though I did delete many images after taking them).  I replaced them with some Lithium AAs which I always have on hand (for my other AA-enabled cameras), and I have already filled the same card once without the battery meter going down.  This camera is not less-efficient than other good cameras, it just isn't effective to use alkaline batteries in cameras regularly.  This one also uses only 2 batteries to make it small, while many better (and larger) cameras which are designed for AAs will take 4 at once.Some older cameras, with no focus or zoom motor, lasted longer on alkaline batteries, but they sucked.Suggested alternatives, if you want to go a step up for more money:1. Canon a1100.  I only played with it briefly, but like most Canons it handles brightness extremes a little better and the pictures are a little sharper.  It also offers an external mode dial which is really handy if you are going to use most of a camera's features.2. Samsung SL201.  More modes, smaller size, and a rechargeable battery.  Similar to the older L100 and L200.

Reviews.Title: luvmyludwig
Reviews.Author: C. Touchton
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this camera and I'm amazed at the quality of pictures it takes.  They are simply amazing.  The camera is easy to use and transfer to the computer is a cinch.  I love the different scenes and modes the camera has and the price was lower than some other cameras that didn't offer the scenes.  I would recommend this camera for anyone.  The camera does use a lot of batteries if you use the review feature a lot, but it isn't a problem for me because the picture quality is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!  Samsung SL30 10MP with/ image stabilization
Reviews.Author: Mardee "Mardee"
Reviews.Content: What a suprisingly great camera!!  You really don't expect to get such a quality camera for $69.00 dollars.  The camera is light weight but sturdy, the view finder is large enough and works great indoors and outdoors.  The real coo for me was the AA batteries, this makes the device very portable and allows you to take as many pictures as you have batteries, unlike a lot of the newer camera's where it cost $20-$30 dollars to buy a back up battery.  With this camera you can buy what you need or use re-chargeable batteries.  The anti-shake/image stabilization is a great feature in a lower cost camera, most less expensive camera's don't offer this very valuable feature. The software that comes with the camera is very user friendly and easy to navigate.  I can't imagine needing any higher quality photo's than what are produced by this great little Samsung...

Reviews.Title: Nice quality reasonable camera
Reviews.Author: Amanda J. Roy
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the camera are very good.  It is easy to use (bought for my 7 year old).  My only complaint (living in sunny South Florida) is that there is no view finder and the screen is hard to make out in the bright sun.  The price is right and the picture quality is good.  My daughter loves having her own camera and has been taking lots f pictures with it.  I also like that it takes regular batteries which makes it easier for charging or just replacing.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: B. Fox
Reviews.Content: I actually picked this camera up for free with Chase credit card reward points. It's a nice camera for the price range it fits into. Takes good quality pictures and video is surprisingly decent as well. There are a couple of downsides for me:1. Image stabilization doesn't seem to work with the flash. You can't use both at the same time as far as I can tell. I have very shaky hands so if I need the flash I just have to concentrate and take a deep breath before I shoot.2. As others have said, it sucks your battery dry very quickly, so I would use rechargeables if possible, or at least always have a spare set with you. Nothing is worse than having your camera batteries die when you need it the most (I am an avid angler, so this has happened to me too many times lol).I hesitated on choosing this camera because the specs do say it doesn't work with 64 bit Vista. I however have had no problem transferring pictures or videos to my 64 bit OS computer. I'm not sure why it would work for me but not others, but it  does. I didn't install any of the software that came with the camera, I just let Vista install the proper driver when I plugged in the USB port. I'm not sure if this makes a difference as to why it works for me or not.Overall, I'm very happy with this little camera. I would gladly have paid the going price if I hadn't gotten it for free.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: JLS RN "oakborn"
Reviews.Content: I have been a very happy Canon user for the last few years but my trusty Canon stopped recognizing memory cards on the day BEFORE Christmas Eve and couldn't afford a new Canon.  So being in the the market for a lower end camera, I did as much research as I could before heading off to buy one.  I actually chose a Nikon Coolpix L20 first and disliked it so much that I returned it in less than 24 hours.I chose the Samsung SL30 to replace the Nikon and though it's not perfect, it's much preferable.  This little camera takes excellent pictures most of the time and they have very true colors.The controls on the camera are all guided menus on the generously-sized LCD screen that is easy to see in all but the brightest sunlight.  This camera has good macro and focus settings and flash settings, face detection and all kinds of things I would  expect on higher end cameras, including digital image stabilization which works well most of the time. This little camera works well in low light and takes decent movies.I am using the super high lithium batteries and have had them in the camera for over 6 months.  So for those who have complained of it gobbling batteries, if you use really good ones, you should have no problems.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly simple and elegant
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Pedersen
Reviews.Content: I love samsung, kind of a loyalist ever since I got into a plasma tv from them.  I wanted to buy a samsung camera that was small enough to be portable and powerful enough not to let me down.  I liked the features on the outside of the box and it was cheap, I had only hoped the thing would be easy to use (powershot was a nightmare, and same with my fujifilm finepix).  The menu system is pure genius and you can get to what you need very quickly.  Battery life is "ok" considering how much this thing does and how great the pictures turn out.  I bought a 2 gig card to go with it.  My favorite feature is actually the video recording, it does this in VGA and at 30FPS!  I then hooked the camera up to my Playstation 3 and it recognized it immediately and I played the videos right off of it!  Awesome camera for the price.  Samsung- you rock my world.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Camera
Reviews.Author: LIMom
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 1 week. So far very happy with purchase.  Camera is easy to use, and nice and small.  The shutter speed is a little slow and the software to print pictures takes some time to get it to print right.  Pictures are very clear.  Definately worth the low price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: savvy shopper "Suzanne"
Reviews.Content: I have purchsed two of these as gifts.  Each person absolutely loved this camera.  They commented on the ease of use and picture quality.  The cost of this camera is well worth what you get in return.

Reviews.Title: Worst Samsung Product Ever
Reviews.Author: D.C.
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I'll start by saying every other Samsung product I've encountered has been fine... celphones, TVs, etc. That's part of why I fell for buying this camera. The $90 price for 10+ megapixels seemed too good to pass up.In the past I've had Olympus, Fuji and Canon digitals (not a Nikon or Kodak or Sony yet). The Fuji and Canon have been the best... the Olympus ones are okay for most situations, but terrible for focus in lower light settings.This Samsung took okay pictures too, although they did seem a little fuzzy for 10 megapixels. Maybe the lens isn't that great?In any case, the main problem with this camera is that it is a WIMP. I first test-used it to take a few pictures around the house and it seemed okay, so I tried it out taking pictures at the Rose Parade. Even though the specifications say it can handle it, it just would not take many pictures in the 40 to 50 degree weather, failing instead and saying the batteries were bad. These were new alkaline batteries, and I even tested them afterwards and the meter said they were still fresh.I decided to give the camera one more try at an event this weekend, and even though I was inside a building, I had come in from the outside (which was around 50 degrees) more than 20 minutes earlier, and it STILL gave that same error.I tried to give it a somewhat more even review at the Samsung site, but they rejected it. That led me to have an even more skeptical view of the company, considering that it may have lack of support for its product if it fails to represent it fairly and honestly.I cannot take it back to the store, since it is past its 90-day return policy there, so I am just giving it away to someone, and letting them know it's probably only good in the house, where it can be pampered. I just don't trust it any more.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality is okay, but
Reviews.Author: Tammy Garner "Tammy,RNinNY"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 14yo daughter. it was easy for her to use,the picture quality is okay/not great for inside shots. The camera is made of plastic which supprise me. I think this is a good camera for a teen just getting her/his first camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: John Neff
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera just before going on vacation.  I was a little worried about response time from clicking the button to taking a picture because of past cameras.  I have been impressed with other Samsung products, so I decided to give it a try.  So far I have been impressed.The response time has been great.  The exception to this is when using the flash or digital image stabilization.  Both of these features can cause a delay.  Otherwise it is quick to capture the picture and then the screen stays blank while it processes.  This is better than some of my other cameras that blanked the screen before capture.I have been very impressed with the image quality in well lighted areas.  With the flash, indoors works well with the tendency to blur, and that is why the image stabilization is nice.  So in the end it has some of the same problems as other digital cameras(blurred low light pictures), yet it also has the options(flash and image stabilization) to overcome these problems if you can deal with the drawbacks of other cameras(slow response).

Reviews.Title: Excellent Digital Camera For The Money
Reviews.Author: F. Price
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the other people who've commented on this camera's experience is with cameras;but my son is a 20 yrs experienced pro photographer and rates this camera "Very High" for it's quality "for the price". He said he has Cannon SLR cameras that don't take any better photos than this one. Samsung has really done their homework on this little digital camera! He says some people expect too much from a budget camera. He recommends this camera "Very Highly" for a budget camera. My son says,if anyone has trouble with shots with this camera (indoors or outdoors)they are not setting the camera's settings properly or they have a defective camera.

Reviews.Title: Use Rechargeable NiMH Batteries !!
Reviews.Author: WinCrazy
Reviews.Content: For Pete's sake, don't use throw-away batteries in any camera !  They're a waste of money in the long run.  Get a couple of sets of 2500 mAH or greater capacity NiMH (nickel metal hydride) rechargeable AA's and a decent charger from MAHA-Powerex, Uniross,  LaCrosse or Panasonic. Don't get a cheapie charger promising 1 hour or less charging times. They will surely destroy your good quality batteries after only a few recharge cycles.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Joanne Luszczak
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my boyfriend's 12 year old sister and it's great for her or anyone.  It's easy to use, small, light, and has great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: very Happy
Reviews.Author: Charles
Reviews.Content: Well, this camara is very nice and good price, 10mp, Although don't have Rechargeable Batteries.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY!!!
Reviews.Author: Shellane J. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for barely two weeks and it is completely broke. The picture quality is terrible then it would delay taking a photo. Then it just went all out and turned on, and will NOT shut off. Ive done all the troubleshooting and it is of no use. The camera is a piece of junk and waste of $80. I will be returning this shortly.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price, but limited.
Reviews.Author: K. Rhodes "Keith"
Reviews.Content: It's a convenient size to keep in a pocket, even a shirt pocket, or a car glove compartment, and image quality is quite good. But there are serious limitations in the menus…If you want to use auto exposure bracketing, you need to be in P mode, but there you can't use the self timer. Crazy little annoyances like that are all over the place.

Reviews.Title: I loooove it
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! So awesome! Works great. Pretty much no complaints, and it has withstood my not so careful keeping. Only wish it had mini mode...

Reviews.Title: Good Camera only one bad thing
Reviews.Author: ThatOneGuy
Reviews.Content: This camera is very great good quality and everything, there is only one small problem with this and that is its battery life. The battery dies way too fast and even with the high capacity batteries. So if you're getting this better have some batteries to go with it. 5 Star for camera photo and video qualities.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Brian Sancranti
Reviews.Content: good camera some ok options, takes pretty good pics but roasts through batteries get some rechargeables. and have them with you

Reviews.Title: Easy To Use But Easy To Break
Reviews.Author: Sw9889 "Sw9889"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about a year (give or take a few months) and at first it seemed great. It was incredibly easy to use. Unlike most cameras that I've seen, though, you need to go into the menu to change the picture settings. The automatic setting takes good pictures. The ISO and Night settings are a little hard to use because you have to keep the camera PERFECTLY still, otherwise it comes out blurry... but that's what tripods are for. The lens quality isn't good after about 2 months of normal use the lens was scratched (and I was very careful with it.... it was my first camera so I was very protective). The scratches showed up on pictures as big gray blotches, and when you're taking pictures of landscapes; big gray blotches don't really add to the effect. Another problem I had was that it was not very durable. I used to keep my camera in my pocket; one day when I took it  out several of the pixels on the right side of the screen (next to the buttons) were dead or discolored. also when I would turn the camera off the power would shut down but the lens wouldn't retract. Lastly the gap between pressing the shutter and taking a picture (with the flash) is too long. So;Pros:Easy to use,Good Picture quality,Portable,Affordable,Fits most tripod units,Uses SD cardCons:Does not have a rechargeable battery,Not very durable,Long shutter to picture gap,Low lens quality,Not a lot of optical zoom,Menu to change picture settings.All in all; for a FIRST camera it's pretty good.... but if you are trying to replace an old one go for something a little more up the market.

Reviews.Title: Very good editing software included!
Reviews.Author: Julio C. Montiel "Julio Montiel Silva"
Reviews.Content: This camera was for a friend of mine that wanted to have her own camera to store her personal photos. She told me that was very pleased with the included software, which edited and corrected faces with very good quality. Therefore I wanted to add this feature and grant 5 stars. The only bad thing was the new rechargeable batteries she had to invest in order to be always on the go.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: FallinStar202
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great choice if you want clean and clear pictures. I took it on vacation to Wisconsin and he scenery is beautiful up there and its hard to capture it sometimes. But with this camera i was able to. After shooting 700 pictures the battery was only on low and it only took about 45 mins for it to recharge.

Reviews.Title: Best in Class.
Reviews.Author: Bruce D. Terry
Reviews.Content: This is the second one of these cameras I have purchased. The first was for the engineering department I work in. I selected it because of the large pixel head and the ability to use alkaline batteries instead of lithium rechargeable ones. It worked so well, I replaced our camera at home (got tired of reaching for the camera after it set for a month and having the rechargeable batteries dead, and the back-ups dead as well). We love this camera.

Reviews.Title: really great camera for a teen beginner
Reviews.Author: A. Squiers
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 13 year old daughter and it has been great.  She uses it constantly and it has taken some "wear & tear".  Takes great, clear pictures and its easy to operate.  A really great camera for a novice photographer!  Good price too.

Reviews.Title: battery hogger
Reviews.Author: Algorhythms
Reviews.Content: The camera is great to work with but is a battery hogger. We have used 2 AA alkaline batteries and it depletes with 15-20 clicks depending on how much flash was used. I would give it a 3 star for its great quality of images, user friendly menu and integration software. I will cut 2 stars from its performance because of its poor battery performance.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Castellanos St. "Citlali"
Reviews.Content: Good size, very easy to use. I like it a lot. Good quality of images.

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: K. He
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap, light, decent constructionCons: Picture quality (lack of optical image stabilization), annoying delay after flashI decided to buy this camera because of the very agreeable price and multiple reviews claiming it had "great picture quality". My experience is the complete opposite.I noticed a problem with the very first picture I took, and tried about 20 more with only a couple turning out halfway decent. I do not claim to be a professional photographer or even a good one, but I suspect this is due to the so-called "digital-image stabilization". While claimed as a feature, this is no excuse for the lack of an optical image stabilizer. The camera basically increases the ISO to compensate for movement, which leads to high distortion especially in indoor scenes. The images look okay when zoomed out, but once I zoom in all the way or view them on my computer, no one in their right mind could claim this was "good picture quality".In short: Do NOT buy if you need high resolution images. I pretty much got what I paid for, but I was greatly misled by the user reviews.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly suprized
Reviews.Author: J. Vega "johnny v"
Reviews.Content: Camera well made.  Picture quality far better than what I expected for a camera of that price range.  Read reviews of the camera on several digital sites before buying and for the combination of price and quality seemed the best option. DVD supplied with instructions on how to operate camera.  I would have preferred a small booklet so I could carry along with camera and learn as needed.  That would be about my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Brandt "Techno gal"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for the price. It is small enough to fit in your pocket and takes a great picture. I would highly recommend this camera for those that want a simple, easy to use, and very portable camera.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the price...
Reviews.Author: Leandro Carneiro "Echoes"
Reviews.Content: I like a lot the digital cameras of samsung... Of course, if you're not professional you need make other choices. I'm very satisfied with this camera. Nice, easy and good quality of photos...

Reviews.Title: Big bang for the bucks
Reviews.Author: DiamondL "sammie"
Reviews.Content: This little camera packs a lot of really nice features into a small body.  The pictures are sharp and color is excellent, even with the zoom.  I shot, printed, and distributed Christmas pics within 1/2 hour!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: W. S. Kennell
Reviews.Content: Good quality for your money. I was leery of this brand b/c not a major camera maker. However, I had a previous model that lasted forever. This even though I lived in the tropics and lent it to poor kids in the interior who took it and did who knows what (not take care of it, that's for sure) to it. Anyways, I bought this one b/c of the previous one and it seems to be working very well so far. Have yet to get it to the tropics, but will have it there soon...Love the fact that it uses SD and SDHD card (common & cheap) as well as AA batteries (I use rechargeable exclusively) which last for a decent length of time.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: David J. Akali
Reviews.Content: Great bargain for the features. This camera is small but takes amazing pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good pics, but....
Reviews.Author: MANDY
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of night shots and action shots. Night mode would hardly work even with the flash on. SLOW shutter speed. Takes good pics otherwise, but being returned.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Anita Antoine
Reviews.Content: This was a camera that I previously purchased at another store and my nephew loved it, so I bought it

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: HonestyisHonorable
Reviews.Content: I have purchased two of these cameras because they are very reliable. I had my first one for years before I dropped it (and made the screen go black). I bought another and it works great. I especially like the macrofocus option which really helps make close-up shots look like you are really there! The features probably aren't top of the line like Canon, but it does everything I need it to do; take fine pictures and decent quality videos!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: John Walker
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip and my video camera which also took stills took a dump and had barely been used. Went to walmart and was looking at cameras and seen this product on a clearance rack with several other cameras. I have been very partial to Samsung products and own other electronic devices made by this company. This has got to be the easiest camera I have ever used. Takes very sharp and crisp pictures and the videos w/sound is just as good. Have only changed the batteries once since August and its now November. Was looking for another one for my mother because of the easy use and operation. I paid $55.00 brand new and they are asking $229.00 for a brand new one. Guess I got a helluva deal. I would reccommend this product and any Samsung products for that matter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: msub
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good value for the money.  It is very durable and works fine till now.  Needs AA battery but if you have rechargebale works fine.  Picture quality is reasonable and uses SD card in the battery slot.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product Samsung SL30 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5 inch LCD (Black)
Reviews.Author: Jose
Reviews.Content: Excellent productExcellent service It was really what I expected, arrived on time, works great ... For the time being no errors ...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for an overseas deployment
Reviews.Author: Dpagoh "Nick"
Reviews.Content: I am on my second deployment and I am kind of late in the game in purchasing a camera, so I bought two of these for my wife and I, and how could you not for the price! To me a deployment is all about the experience, and I like to be able to capture as much of the experience as I possibly can, because as they say, a picture is worth a thousand words. This could not be more true. The picture quality is great, as well as the outer display. Though it may not have a whole lot of features, it more than makes up for it with the quality of each picture/experience. I have never used anything but Samsung cameras, just for this reason alone, and because of how easy they are to use, and if properly taken care of they will last you a while. I had a Samsung camera last deployment that I gave to my brother three years ago and it's still kicking. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone. It's small, lightweight, and so easy to use my 4 year old niece can figure it out.

Reviews.Title: A good camera
Reviews.Author: Cami
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple years and it is a good camera for the inexpensive cost.  Batteries last a long time and no little quirks on it have broken or anything, but I am a bit picky about the color tone, it is a little cool/cold (green/blue as opposed to warm like gold/orange tones) and the video camera is not good unless light is REALLY bright.  I just found a lot richer color from other cameras I had in the past that broke quicker though, and this camera does not have a whole lot of shooting settings.  But it is good for its price.

Reviews.Title: Used camera NOT New ast stated.
Reviews.Author: Used camera NOT New as stated
Reviews.Content: Regarding Samsung SL30.I had purchased the above camera from your site as a gift for my husband. My understanding was the camera was NEW, however what I received was a very used camera that barly works.I have been a regular customer with Amazon.com for the 2 years and have never had a bad experence with any of my purchases until now.From now forward, I will have to find a new site to order from. As this camera was a totally waste of my money.Thank you,

Reviews.Title: Mrs.Simon
Reviews.Author: carla beth traughber
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed with the picture quality and the batteries, Our last samsung was much better and that is why I bought this one but I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great price for Samsung camera
Reviews.Author: MOHMMAD A AL MTAIRI
Reviews.Content: Really great price for a camera from a big company like SamsungWhen i receive a package I was very excited , So i tried itis excellent also the pictures taken good .thanks for Seller ..

Reviews.Title: An okay camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Productiongirl
Reviews.Content: I feel like the picture quality is less than I had expected with it being 10 mega pixels. I also find the menu to be annoying since it doesn't have a quick way to change the camera's settings. Otherwise it's nice in pink and came quickly and in good condition.

Reviews.Title: best camera i ever had
Reviews.Author: DiamondStilletos "dream angel"
Reviews.Content: compared to the one time disposable cameras i use to take pix for events and special occasions, of course this product is so much better than that so much. i thought it was going to be a thin cam but it has some depth and quality to it its a real camera. it takes pix so amazing the color the vibrannce alive when it was not there .the quality is welll done portable nywhere and design is cute as a button  and the color and vibrancey is brilliant the only i would change is the buttons which i have to get used to using like what button is for what its a good cam and i wouldnt trade itbut also u cannot put the camera near flammables and never use it with wet hands or get it wet. it would be damaged and dont put incompatable batteries and thats all

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: melisstau30
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I wish I had bought this camera for myself!  Since I bought this camera for my daughter it has entertained her like nothing else!  She was 7 when she got it for Christmas, and it took better pictures that day than my more expensive point and shoot!  She has figured out how to set the timer to take pictures of her while she jumps and the video works great too!  Absolutely the best camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: Doug K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago.  I was looking for an inexpensive camera for my son and decided on this one.  This is a great little camera (about the size of a deck of cards).  It was a breeze to set up and is just as easy to use.  What surprised me most, was the picture quality.  This camera takes awesome pictures - and does well in low light rooms.Some reviews complain about the battery access latch being flimsy.  While you do have to be careful with it, I have not found this to be an issue.  I do suggest rechargeable batteries, because it likes batteries.  I like this camera so much that I bought the SL50 for my daughter this year.

Reviews.Title: Nice but.....
Reviews.Author: MAIOSH
Reviews.Content: THis is a good little camera and has some excellent features however the battery problem with this camera outweighs the positive attributes. After taking 10-15 pictures your batteries are DEAD. My duaghter is constantly recharging batteries and they only last for a few pictures. We decided to buy just alkaline batteries to see if she would have better luck with this problem and found that we were spending a ton of money on batteries that only lasted 10-20 pictures before going dead. I would look for a camera with similar features but does not drain the batteries. You may spend a little more but in the long run you will actually be saving money.

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my mother...
Reviews.Author: M. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Wanted a simple, easy to use camera for my mom since she was still using a 2.3 MP cam and this one was perfect.The price was great.  Her pictures look good, and she loves it.It was very easy for her to figure out and she is not a techno friendly person.It was her Xmas present & she/I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Camera
Reviews.Author: Melissa Kent "Shot girl"
Reviews.Content: My camera came in perfect condition and I love it. The quality is better than the previous digital camera I had from a different brand. The shots are clearer and it's very simple to use.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: J. Cardenas Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth SAMSUNG camera I buy for my sons. Never dissapointed. the pictures are fantastic, even on indoors, focus always, crispy colors, face detection 100%, flash light strong, easy to handle, easy way to setting your preferences on the menu, the only complain: the battery life is very short. always carry a pair of batteries extra. AMAZON.COM is my best friend, I love to buy online.

Reviews.Title: Great for casual use
Reviews.Author: Natalie Deming "new home owner"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my neighbor as a gift. It is not top of the line, but it is absolutely excellent for casual family photos. I would buy it again in a heartbeat, it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Good gift for Christmas
Reviews.Author: K. Pietrusinski
Reviews.Content: Actually I bought this camera for my son as a Christmas gift. He is truly enjoying it so much so I think I will eventually purchase one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Elvert Joga
Reviews.Content: This Is a pretty good camera. Quality is great. The price makes it accesable and I've already dropped it twice with no real damage. I did have to buy some 1.6 V rechargeable Batteries (POWERGENIX NIZN AA Batteries) because regular ones just dont stand up to this high consumption device. It works incredible with those batteries.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: Roger Brockevelt "cruise man"
Reviews.Content: This camera is exceptional quality for the money. Very satisfied with the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use/super photo quality
Reviews.Author: T. Allen
Reviews.Content: I purchaesd this camera for my 10-year old as her first camera and it has been great. The ease of learning how to use, the photo quality, etc. is exceptional.  A perfect camera for her (and for me!)

Reviews.Title: samsung camera
Reviews.Author: James E. Lyon
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for what I bought it for. It is a second camera that is very portable and fits in my pocket. The pictures are pretty good, my grandkids had red eye but the software that came with the camera cleaned it up.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Marcos Vargas "Mc. Vargas"
Reviews.Content: I had purchase many cameras here (amazon) and it is one of the best cameras that I purchased here. It has an excellent picture quality, and it's easy to use. I purchased it for my girlfriend birthday, and she love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Mohammed Balogun "Love it"
Reviews.Content: The item was received as described on product page will definitely by from seller again. Fast shipping and excellent customer service A++++.

Reviews.Title: camera looks great!
Reviews.Author: J. Consoomr "skubadivr"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a Kodak I sold before it's time. I bought this camera for it's price and because once I had a Sony camera with the same megapixel rating as a friend's Samsung and the resulting pictures were overwhelmingly inferior. The Sony which I thought would be a great camera took mediocre pictures, the Samsung took excellent pictures. So I am buying this based on that experience. I hope my Samsung pictures are half as good as the ones my buddy took with his Samsung.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Trudy E. Norem "I Love my Ranger"
Reviews.Content: So check this out, I purchased this camera for my 19 year old Marine for his birthday.  He had the camera five days and the lens has now locked half in and half out.  Since he will be coming home and has all the paperwork with him for the attempted return, he opted to buy another while waiting to come home and replace this one.  Guess what?  No really, go ahead and guess.  Yep, that one broke also, this time it lasted 2 damn days!  2 days folks.  The same exact problem.  Seriously.  I would not buy this piece of crap ever again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. O'Brien
Reviews.Content: Shipping was fast and camera was received in excellent condition. Great pictures and lots of features for such an affordable camera. Definitely two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung SL30 10MP Digital
Reviews.Author: Paula Inniss
Reviews.Content: When taking pics the display was very blurry, hence making it difficult to focus on the object/ person etc. The sellers should have indicated that the internal camera memory only allowed for three (3) shots and purchasing memory could be costly. Will not recommend, didn't like at all. I purchase a Kodak C340 some years ago while I was in College and the picture quality was much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Donaldson "Robin"
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I got this one easy to use and takes great photo's.All so it was at a great price.I like the fact the day and time you can see before taking your photo my old one you couln't see and it would change and it would say a different date.Came in good time and in good condition.If your going to buy a camera buy this one your be happy your did.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: CHRISTIAN D. JACKSON
Reviews.Content: I was excited in receiving my product on time and intact, but has been disapponted in the results from the photos I hvae taken on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera, Does not last long
Reviews.Author: Mar1223
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera. Poor quality made.  The batteries put in the camera do not last long.  I have tried chargable and non chargable.  I even sent an email to Samsung and they never replies.  Do not buy this junk.  I now have a black dot on my pictures cause a pixel died.  I cannot believe it. This only lasted over a year and a half long. I will never buy this brand.

Reviews.Title: Another superior product from Samsung
Reviews.Author: TeePee Cali
Reviews.Content: It is very user friendly and just what I needed.  I love Samsung products because of the consistency on their products and excellent customer service.  I would recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung SL30
Reviews.Author: Amy Valentine "amyamycakes"
Reviews.Content: I had purchase this camera for college. I had it for a year now and some way my memeory card gets lock up. I went through two memory cards and it did it to both. I dont know how to get it to unlock. Now some people say its a battery hogger, well yes it is. I bought rechargeable batteries and it last alot longer.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, compact size
Reviews.Author: Wilson G. Jimenez
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my wife and she really has enjoyed using it. One drawback is that it did not come with a memory card so when trying to record a video the "memory full" popup comes up. Other than that, a great starter camera.

Reviews.Title: disappointed in Amazon
Reviews.Author: R
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera in the mail. I am disappointed because when I searched for a digital camera using the Amazon site I specified that I needed an optical, as well as LCD viewfinder. The Samsung SL30 came up as meeting that specification. It does not. It only has the LCD viewfinder, which I should have realized by examining the picture of the camera more closely. I trusted Amazon's search. Amazon should get this info right, and the manufacturers should give clearer specs as to what the camera's features are, what's in the box, what type of batteries are used, etcetera.Pros: So far the camera is very easy to use, has very nice picture quality, is really tiny, uses AA batteries, easy to transfer pics to my computer (comes with cable).Cons: no optical viewfinder, feels kind of flimsy (especially the battery door...which is what broke on the my Fuji Finepix S700, essentially ruining the otherwise functioning camera). Definitely don't think the SL30 would recover from a drop on the floor, also a pretty long delay in flash for low light pics.Seems like a nice little camera for someone who doesn't know much about cameras and just wants to take some fun snapshots. Easy and portable.Unfortunately, I think it's getting returned because I really HATE using the LCD to take a picture.

Reviews.Title: very good camera!!i love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Amaury G. Ortiz "Amaury"
Reviews.Content: very good camera,i been usin it for over an year,and so far no complains!!!!i bought it to muy sister for her birthday and she fascinared!!!i recomended,and for the price is a good deal!!!!..other cameras more expensives are not as good as this one!!!!!.....good product!!and the manual is very helpul!!....

Reviews.Title: Too Limited
Reviews.Author: Picky-Picky
Reviews.Content: The Samsung SL30 may be the perfect match for some customers but I am very sorry I bought it.  It is incompatible with a 64 bit operating system and that means I cannot transfer pix to either of my computers.  That makes it pretty useless to me.  This severe limitation is not mentioned in any advertising materials I have seen but it is clearly described in the owner's manual.  Sadly, to read it in the owner's manual means you already own the camera.

Reviews.Title: Umm.. Not what I expected..
Reviews.Author: Jessica Vergeson
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera the day that I got it. It didn't record, it killed my batteries instantly, and most of all it tweaked on me too much. You get what you paid for..

Reviews.Title: Exelent
Reviews.Author: Junior Mesen Quiros "ChuneCR"
Reviews.Content: This camera is excellent and the price is best, I liked the time he was very little to get to my seat.

Reviews.Title: Undelivered
Reviews.Author: Johanna Amar
Reviews.Content: I did not receive the product. It was lost among the tons of Christmas gifts. I was reimbursed though by Amazon.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.2-megapixel resolution for large, photo quality prints
3x optical zoom; 2.5-inch Intelligent LCD screen
Digital image stabilization; Face detection
Movie mode (VGA 30fps, MJPEG)
Capture images to SD/SDHC/MMC cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung SL30 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5 inch LCD (Silver)
